summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate check sheets for the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated July 21, 2019. The sheets record staff signatures for scheduled inmate observation rounds, following a protocol requiring inmates to be observed at least twice per hour. The document is significant as it provides a procedural record from the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death.

events.title: Daily Inmate Observation Rounds
events.description: Standard 30-minute check sheets were completed for inmates in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York, documenting staff observations throughout the day.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a set of inmate observation logs from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit (SHU) dated July 21, 2019.
The logs follow a strict protocol requiring staff to observe inmates in locked-down status at least twice per hour, on an irregular schedule no more than 40 minutes apart.
The sheets are for multiple tiers (G, H, L, M, J, K) within the SHU, indicating a standard procedure was being followed across the unit.
Each sheet is reviewed and signed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain, demonstrating a chain of oversight.
The document is a routine administrative record from the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated, providing context for standard operating procedures.
